document_title: Acute pharyngitis: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content: Acute pharyngitis is an acute inflammation and infection of the mucosa of the back of the throat leading to red, swollen throat, pain, burning, itching and causing cough. The disease usually lasts 1-2 weeks. The most common cause is a number of viruses such as parainfluenza virus, influenza virus, rhinovirus, coronavirus and respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), but bacteria can also cause the disease.(1)
subsection_title: benh viem hong cap.json. What is acute pharyngitis?

benh viem hong cap.json. What is acute pharyngitis?
Acute pharyngitis is an acute inflammation and infection of the mucosa of the back of the throat leading to red, swollen throat, pain, burning, itching and causing cough. The disease usually lasts 1-2 weeks. The most common cause is a number of viruses such as parainfluenza virus, influenza virus, rhinovirus, coronavirus and respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), but bacteria can also cause the disease.(1)
